posts.content:
Why do some forum members think that because they join the forum they are members of the club, so there for can camp on SSVC per book pitches or events ( vanfest being an example ) & have a say in the running of our club ,they can't . can they !!!!!!!!!, pay your subs... like we do .
Joanne

By not joining the club but just joining the forum they are missing the wonderful bi monthly magazine, camping at Victoria Farm (see other threads on here to know just how popular this event is!!), valuation service, technical advice service and other member only advantages.

My question is - would the forum and the SSVC website be what it is without paid up members?

Dolly Daydream wrote:
Why do some forum members think that because they join the forum they are members of the club, so there for can camp on SSVC per book pitches or events ( vanfest being an example ) & have a say in the running of our club ,they can't . can they !!!!!!!!!, pay your subs... like we do .
Joanne




Camp on SSVC sites with T25's T5's T4's Bay's and any other thing EXCEPT a SPLIT

The forum was set up to be be used by anyone. Restricting it to just paid up members would do it no favours, cut the traffic, and make it far less popular. The forum is good PR for the SSVC. You are in danger becoming a clique if you limit things ;):)

gizmo wrote:
The forum was set up to be be used by anyone. Restricting it to just paid up members would do it no favours, cut the traffic, and make it far less popular. The forum is good PR for the SSVC. You are in danger becoming a clique if you limit things ;):)


I agree the forum is for ALL but the benefits of joining the club are great. There is however a common misconception that joining the forum is the same as joining the SSVC!!

Camp on SSVC sites with T25's T5's T4's Bay's and any other thing EXCEPT a SPLIT

I love the club for the people as much as for the vehicles and many a time in the early days of owning our van we would turn up in whatever we had (not even VW) and a tent or caravan. On many occasions we set off in the van but ended up on site in something different!!

Terry
